title: Will Congress Give Obama Trade Deal Authority?
teaser: President Obama is asking Congress to give him authority to fast-track a U.S. commitment to the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
contentencoded:
The future of the Trans-Pacific Partnership, a potential free-trade pact being negotiated among 12 Pacific Rim countries, is in the hands of the Senate today.

President Obama is asking Congress to give him authority to fast-track a U.S. commitment to the potential trade pact, but as NPR Senior Business Editor Marilyn Geewax tells Here & Now’s Robin Young, some Democrats and some Republicans in Congress are against giving the president fast-track authority.

Guest

  • Marilyn Geewax, senior business editor for NPR. She tweets @geewaxnpr.
